intro: Hieracium poaczense, commonly known as the Polish hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring moist to moderately dry conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium poaczense is known for its aggressive growth and can become invasive in certain habitats.
